body.name: iDOO Water Heated Mattress Pad, FSA HSA Eligible, Heated Electric Mattress Pad no Electric Wire no Radiation, 12h Timer Setting, Birthday Valentines Gifts for Women Men, Energy Saving, 60‘’x80‘’
features: No Electromagnetic Radiation:Thanks to water and electricity separation heating technology, water is circulated into the mattress through an internal circulation system, which is completely radiation-free and has no risk of fire or overheating, the interior uses medical-grade PVC hoses, so there is no leakage problem at all,can be used with 100% confidence, is safer and more comfortable than traditional heated mattresses.

Intelligent Control: iDOO heated mattress warmer Includes touch button intelligent control, quilt drying, temperature controlled digital heating, timing, automatic shutdown, sleep mode, etc. You can easily adjust the mattress temperature, timed off, and mode switching according to your preferences. Instant heating without waiting. Warm water circulation technology ensures that the entire mattress remains at a uniform temperature, helping you fall asleep faster.

Energy Saving: The water tank capacity of this water heated mattress pad is 450ml, saving up to 50% compared to electric heating mattress pads by recirculating warm water so you can stay warm without high heating bills.Note:Please read the user manual carefully before using the product.

Silent Design:This water heated mattress pad adopts suspension type mute technology,noise less than 25db, create a peaceful and relaxed sleeping environment for you. It is an ideal choice for patients with muscle and joint stiffness, pain, tension, or sleep disorders.

HSA FSA Eligible Items Only List: iDOO Water Heated Mattress Pad Queen is a great gift ideas for family or friends in the special day, likes christmas day valentine’s day, birthday or mother’s day father's day, can be used as a christmas gifts for women men.

Excellent Customer Service: We offer a 1-year warranty and provide lifetime customer service. No matter you have any problem with the machine, please contact us immediately. Warm Tips: If not used for a long time, please use the included hand pump to push water from one hose port through the other, after draining the water,cover the hose connectors and block the hose port.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works well for cold nights but my first one stopped turning on. Got it replaced no problem since.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Where has this been all my life?
reviews.reviewText: I’ve transformed my bed into a cocoon. We can turn the heat down a lot lower in the house at night because of this. It’s the best heat ever. Magical. My hips and knees feel 20 years younger. This thing is amazing. And it’s HSA approved. The biggest it came in was a queen and I have a king. There’s really not but a few inches on each side it doesn’t cover and who sleeps right there anyways? You won’t regret this purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars works as intended
reviews.reviewText: pro: works as intended; straps keep mattress heater in placecon: always worrying about water leaking; a bit difficult to change settings; directions don't help as much; heating unit runs fairly short hosetip: use a mattress topper in between the mattress and the mattress heater to protect it in case it does leak (you'll still have to clean it up, but at least it won't soak the mattress...)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars iDOO Water Heated Mattress Pad, Heated Electric Mattress Pad no Electric Wire no Radiation
reviews.reviewText: This iDOO Water Heated Mattress Pad, Heated Electric Mattress Pad no Electric Wire no Radiation is much better than the coiled type mattress pads of old that seem to dry out my skin. This mattress pad provides the heated water circulating through the stand alone unit that sits on a night stand or on the floor next to your bed. ( I do wish the water tube that the water flows through we a tad bit longer so that the unit can sit on the floor or night stand a bit more discretely. (Not a deal breaker) I was surprised at the warmth and heat that the mattress pad provided in record time you could feel the heat emitting. The mattress pad was simple to lay out and install on the top of your mattress. The long loop bungy elastic bands easily fit around the mattress corner holding the mattress pad in place. The table top unit allows you to set the temperature, & shut off timer. Using this iDOO Water Heated Mattress Pad, Heated Electric Mattress Pad no Electric Wire no Radiation allows me to set my home thermostat down even lower providing a better cost savings against my home heating cost. The unit container was easy to fill with water sliding off the panel and filling to the water fill line that pumps and circulates the water throughout the heated mattress pad. You don't even hear the unit running once powered on and the heated temperature is set. I feel really toasty underneath my covers with this mattress pad in place it feels good to to have to feel the coils felt through using the electric heated mattress pad. So, after testing out this iDOO Water Heated Mattress Pad, Heated Electric Mattress Pad no Electric Wire no Radiation pad even though the cost is a few dollars more than what I've seen of the electric mattress pads this unit will save you much more money in the long run keeping you warm and toasty. Good value I would recommend this iDOO Water heated mattress pad the quality is solid.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Much better than expected
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this in hopes that I can cut down from running my heater as much during this winter. My first alternative was a floor heater, it does the job but is heavy on my energy use. Trying this heated pad does help plenty. I like the fact that it’s actual water running through the blanket opposed to wires, etc.My first concern was whether the water would get clogged in the tubes by laying on it. I tested it by bending and bundling the blanket unrealistically and the results were good. It also comes with a small air pump, just in case it clogs.Like some room heaters, it also has a button button that turns it off if the devices surfaced isn’t flat. The second safety feature is an alert/cut off when there’s not enough water in the reservoir. The max temp is 140 degrees, which is very warm but doesn’t feel hot. The material of the pass itself is surprisingly soft enough to sleep on itself. The only mentionable con that I can find with this would be the length of the tube that connects the pad to the machine. Overall it’s a great product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is really cool, but HOT! Lol
reviews.reviewText: Whew is this thing knows how to turn up the heat! Very easy to set up straightforward to use. can’t believe it’s a water-based product. You really can’t tell. I forgot I turned it on and woke up in the middle of the night in a sweat so just watch the temperature. Overall, super cool product

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Simple set up and easy to use. The tubes are just long enough to sit below the nightstand and heats pretty quickly. It has a child lock feature as well as a timer so you can set it and forget it. It does feel a bit weird to lay on as you can feel the tubes in the bed. So far no leaks and it’s running smoothly. (Knock on wood) Overall, it’s a good buy as you can warm up the ed before you jump in it on those cold nights or days.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love that it has a timer!
reviews.reviewText: There’s nothing like getting under the covers of a warm bed when it is freezing cold outside. This water heated mattress pad ensures that your bed is comfy and warm when you get under the covers. It does a great job keeping things warm but not hot, and you can set the timer to turn off, so it doesn’t keep heating you all night. The idea of it using water is something I haven’t heard of before, but hey if it works! My only concern is if, over time this springs a leak, it could potentially cause issues with the mattress. So, for now I am just keeping an eye on it, and my pets away from it. Thus far it is cool idea, that seems a lot safer than the old wired heating blankets.
